text: Pours golden with a hint of amber discoloration, no top, whatever there is of the head is slightly off-white. Strong hoppy aroma, citrus and lemon grass, a slight sour aromatic hint at the end. Slightly skunky maybe. Texture is oily, has body, low carbonation, almost flat, hoppy kick, gives way to a slightly sweet body, followed by a nice, gentle dry aftertaste. Good job!
Cask at Cross Keys, Hednesford. Pours pale golden with a white head. Nicely balanced citrus led session ale.

Cask Half Pint at Kingston Beer Festival, Kingston, Surrey, June 2009 - Golden in colour. Very citrus fruity; very grapefruit and lemon. Hoppy; piney and earthy hops. Bitter fruity hoppy throughout. Crisp & refreshing. Nice beer! (2009-06
Kittysissä real alena. Hieno kukkainen tuoksu, sitruksisen kevyt ja saippuainen suutuntuma.
Cask at the 2017 Manchester Beer Festival. Gold pour with a white head. Vanilla, soft spice and citrus aroma. Shed loads of citrus fruit in the flavour. Refreshing brew.

On cask at the Manchester Beer Festival, pours a clear medium yellow with an off white head. The smell is fairly juicy citrus, floral and delicate. The taste is floral, citrus, pretty juicy with a dry end. Very light in body with nice carbonation. Very pleasant 4.0% beer.
Bottle at home, 26th November 16. Pours light straw, aroma is fresh hay, grass, citrus. Taste is light perfume, nice hops, easy drinking.

Cask at The George, Croydon. It pours clear gold with a decent white head. The aroma is fresh, doughy malt, tangerine, atone fruits and hay. The taste is crisp, dry, bitter, grassy, dank, pithy lemon, touch of soap, peppery spice and straw with a dry finish. Light - medium body and soft carbonation. Pretty tasty. A grade-A gold.
500ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours a lively straw with small white head. Fruity hop aromas, some citrus, pine.Similar flavors, a little sweet, quite dry throughout and a slight bitter finish.

Cask. Appearance is quite clear and very light straw/golden. Aroma is fruity hops, grassy, citrus fruit. Taste- soft citrusy hops, summer fruits, zesty undertones, bitter hoppy finish. Nice and refreshing.
Cask at Crate. Light golden colour. Thin head. Very pleasant, quenching, sessionable golden ale with a hint of citric hop in the finish. Not overly aggressively tasty but balanced. An easy drinker.

Pours a straw colour with a small white head. Aroma has light floral hops, grass & citrus fruits. Taste is also quite light, but really crisp, with citrus, peach, pine, grass, some biscuit & some honey. Finish is lingering bitter, grassy and crisp.

Cask @ Gallows Bird. Slightly hazy golden beer nice frothy head. Aroma has sweet tropical fruits, citrus, orange, grapefruit. Taste is quite sweet with fruit flavours, then slight grapefruit bitterness and flowery notes. Smooth texture and medium body from cask. Nice and tasty for a cask beer novice.

Cask at Odfellows. Clear golden body with a dense white head. Great lacing. Aroma of grapefruit, biscuit and tangerine. Flavour of orange, bright juicy hops and grass. Medium body with a smooth mouthfeel. Soft carbonation prickle. Fruity and beautifully balanced.
500ml bottle. Pale in colour, with a fine white head. Aroma of hay. Finely carbonated with a bitter aftertaste, and pleasant notes of butter and citrus.
Cask at Ushers. Pours hazy golden yellow with a thin bubbly white head. Aromas of Leon, orange, cereal. Taste is bitter lemon. Thin finish.
Light citrus aroma. Pale golden beer. White creamy head. Its light, slightly grapefruity. Creamy mouthfeel. Its nice but nothing special. Could do with a bit more kick to it.
Cask at the Red Lion, Amblecote. Pours light gold with a small head. Aroma is mango and grapefruit juice. Taste has grapefruit juice to start with a medium bitter finish.

Bottle from minutemat as part of European Local swap, many thanks.  Orange golden color with thick white head. Nice citrus hoppy aroma with oranges, tangerines, pines. Nice citrus hoppy taste with oranges, tangerines, together with solid caramel malty backbone. Long fruity, hoppy bitter finish. Very good.
Not bad nice hopness its ok it c9uld be better whats more love of hops more juice to let loose

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2016 Cask at The Fountain, Leek. A clear straw colour with a thin white head. Aroma of lemon, peach, grapefruit, subtle biscuit and floral hops. Taste of lemon, peach, some orange, some melon, slight grapefruit, subtle biscuit and floral hops. Light bodied and soft carbonation. A soft, floral hop bitterness in the finish. Quite a simple golden ale overall but I can tell this is so well made and its really sessionable. Great citrusy flavours, nice.

500ml bottle from Moonshine & Fuggles, Ironbridge. Yellow golden colour, white foam head leaving lacing and zesty orange & lemon citrus hop aroma. Flavour is light malt with citrus, grapefruit hoppy bitterness. Light bodied, soft carbonation, dry tangy bitter finish. Very drinkable.
On cask @ Richmond pub Liverpool a clear golden ale with fruity floral aroma flavour is lemon grapefruit citrus fruit light bitterness on finish sharp refreshing golden ale
Cask at the magnet Stockport... Golden yellow amber.. Small white head... Soft sweet zezty custardy lemon fruits nose. Soft custardy.. Big juicy lemon
tried at the White Head, Tewkesbury. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma has a nice citrus kick, the taste decently bitter to the finish. Nice

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Light golden, sort of pee- coloured. Pale malts, cotrys, green yellow berries. Light refreshing body. Good bitters, reslly hoppy citrus flavour. But oh so refreshing. It is well bittered, but otherwise could drink liters of it, as a pineapple juice substitute.-- bb

Aroma: light floral hops, grass, citrus fruits. Appearance: clear white gold, average, frothy, white head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: light body, minerals, 
Overall: nice Golden Ale, light and bitter. Pint at GBBF 2015, Kensington Olympia.
Not much aroma. Peachy and floral, with a burst of citrus zest in aftertaste. A nice, light beer

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2015, London - pours golden with a white head. Aroma and taste is medium sweet fruity and pale malty, some pleasing citrus lemon and satsuma notes, hay, grassy and floral hoppy nuances abound, refreshing and easy drinking, this didnt last long and this at last completes all English counties for me! :-)

Cask from The White Lion, Disley, Cheshire, £3.10/pint. 

Pale amber beer with the slightest hint of carbonation and small but creamy white head. Looks good. Nose is pleasant and laden with tropical fruit namely lychee, peach and mango. Taste opens bitter with slight earthy skunkiness. Id bet good money theres citra hops in this. Some honey and orange sweetness to the later flavour but a largely dry finish. Really enjoyable - manages to be overtly fruity without being overly delicate which is a hard balance to strike.

Cask at gbbf day 5. Cleat golden yellow coloured pour with a loose white head that lasts. Aroma is very vibrant, spicy chive and citrus, lemons and tropical fruit notes. Flavour is clean base malts. Light straw, chive, mango, lemon crisp. Palate is light and semi crisp, mice cask condition. Lovely refreshing golden . lovely.

How: Cask.
Where: Oliver Twist, Stockholm.
Appearance: Clear golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Malt, citrus, some fruit.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: A little bitterness, citrus, fruit. Bitter finish.

Cask at Oliver Twist, Stockholm. Clear pale golden beer with since lasting offwhite head. Hoppy grassy citrus aroma, floral, peach, hay, spicy notes, some caramel. Hoppy citrus flavor, peppery, grapes, floral, spicy, hay, some caramel and wet grass. Quite nice.

Cask at Montgomerys Tower, Shrewsbury. Vivid gold with a thick white head. Zingy fresh lemon with moderate pine and grapefruit following, and sweet lime balancing a crisp bitterness at the end. Really tasty stuff. Excellent for the ABV.
Nice straw coloured beer, lightly hopped..........................................

500 ml bottle, bb 10 Feb 16, from my European Local Swap sender minutemat. Thanks Mat!
Crystal clear, light golden body, with a medium, quickly dissipating, frothy, white head.
Quite light aroma of grains, citrus, grass, some pine, some sweet malts.
Taste is also quite light, but really crisp, with citrus, peach, pine, grass, some biscuit, some honey.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes bitter, grassy, piney, a bit zesty.

Nice one. Very sessionable and refreshing, with a light, but enjoyable flavour with lots of hops. Should be a perfect summer beer.

Half, cask, house beer at Magnet. Clear straw coloured body. Fair white head. Solid lacing. Mid-sweet citrus on the nose. Fruity flavours with grapefruit to the fore added by peach. Dry fruit bitter tail. Nice (Stockport 03.02.2015).
A glorious surprise, sparkling clear with frothy white head. A powerful aroma of hops, lemons and grapefruit, push through a crisp malt background. A long finish with plenty in the middle

500ml bottle. Clear, yellow-ish golden colour with average, frothy to creamy, fairly lasting and lacing, white head. Biscuity, pale malty aroma with hints of hay, a touch of lemon tea, lemon yoghurt. Taste is biscuity malty, lemon notes, sponge cake, lemon yoghurt, hints of lime, a very cautious grassy touch; tight alliance of biscuit sweetness and lemon tartness, super soft palate. Fluid "Zitronenrolle".

Pours almost completely clear golden color, topped with average slightly off white head. Very pleasant fruity aroma, some notes of citruses also present. The taste is pleasantly malty, some caramel notes with very decent bitterness in the end.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2015 Cask at the Grapes, Liverpool. Yellow bordering on straw. Light wispy natural head. Aroma is light citrus, candyfloss/marshmallow, a hint of freshly mowed grass. Bitter taste with a sweet edge. Loads of hop flavour for its ABV. Thin body but a tasty hoppy bitter aftertaste. A notch or two above your average cask golden.

Another I failed to make notes on at the time, but I recall this bottle to pour pale yellow, with a tropical fruit aroma; taste was lemon and especially lime; very dry with some pleasant new world hops; decent, but not moreish enough to score especially highly.
Classy one with decent sweetish moments and high drinkabilty. Some vanilla mixed up with butter, hops and south american fruits. Nice one.

Bottle from my Summer Santa - many thanks! The ale pours out in a deep golden colour with low head and flat body. Aroma of hops and straw with some vanilla hints. Taste of fresh, mild hops, light barley, light caramel, flowers, light malt and hay. Refreshing and very solid drinkable. Enjoyed it.
Cask at the Hanging Bat. Pours amber golden, pine, toffee nose, taste is sweet, juicy hops, quite bitter.
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and light bitter finish. 110614

Bottle @ Christers. Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma of malt, sweet fruity hops, melon, light peach. Flavor is malt, light fruity hops, melon, peach. Thin to medium body, average carbonation. 110614
Bottle, 4%. Slightly hazy yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hop and a little citrus. Flavour is malt, fruit, hop, little citrus, little sweet, little earthy and a little bitter.
Bottle. Medium head with medium duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are grass, straw, malt and hops. Nice dry finish.

Cask at the Moon Under Water (JDW), Watford on 18 Feb 2013. Poured a clear, mid golden colour, with a dense white head and good lacing. Aroma of tropical fruits, citrus hops and golden syrup. Full flavours; grapefruit hops, tangy fruit and a biscuity malt backbone. Finish was balanced bitter hop resin, brown sugar and lemon zest.

500 ml. bottle dated best before 2/11/15. It pours a very clear pale gold color with a disappearing white head. The aroma has nice biscuity malt with hints of honey and citrusy, tropical fruity hops. The flavor is a little more floral and piney with citrus and a good balanced base of bready, biscuity malt. Light bodied and a bit watery near the finish, which is also moderately piney bitter. Pretty nice session beer.
Cast at Angleterre, Helsinki. Originally rated 31032012. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, grain and malts.
Cask post office vaults Birmingham. Golden color slight bubbly head. Grapefruit citrus aroma. Taste is grapefruit some sweet malts good bitter hoppy finish. Body bit thin. Good smell and taste.
Cask (Bridge Tavern, Newcastle) - Golden in colour. Grapefruit and a hint of passion fruit in the aroma. Refreshing and moderately hoppy taste with grapefruit, lemon and passion fruit detected.
Pours a clear pale golden with a small fluffy head. Aroma is flowery and slightly hoppy. Taste is sweet malts,fruity,with a decent hop bitterness buildup in the aftertaste. Light and nice.

Cask at NERAX. Straw yellow, white bubbles. Fresh citrus aroma, some sileage and bramble. Quite intense hoppiness. Slight bready malt flavour with a lovely citrus hop character. Lingering hops in the aftertaste, quite dry and nice and smooth. Simply one of the best beers at 4% or less Ive ever tried.
Bottle 0,5ltr: Clear golden coloured brew with an fruity bitter taste and this great Shropshire Golden Ale got an American touch.

Great hoppy 4% British golden ale.
Drinks more flavourful than the strength would suggest.
Cask at SIBA Beer X. Yellow. White, bubbly head. Mint. Flora. Taste is grapefruit dry, fresh bitterness. Fresh palate. Bitter finish.

Used to be my regular tipple until I moved pub. The pub where I used to drink it also serves many other apparently very good draught beers and ciders, as well as a huge collection of continental bottled beverages. I realised, after going there twice a week for about a year, that I had tried nothing but Oracle - because it was so good.

500ml bottle from Ales by Mail
BBE FEB 15 - Pours clear golden with a smooth white head. Aroma of fresh stingy grassy hops, earthy notes, crisp maltiness and hints of bread. Taste is smooth, grassy hoppy and crisp with some maltiness and earthy notes. Finish is lingering bitter, grassy and crisp. Pretty good classic golden ale with a touch of US hops.

Bottle @ home, gift from dEnk I believe, thanks! Clear apple juice golden color, small white head that diminishes quickly though that may be because I served it a bit too cold. Aroma and taste are malts, hops, nicely bitter, nice grassy hoppyness. Decent body, firm carbonation.

Bottle from Ales By Mail [210214]
Light golden, clear, frothy pillowy white head, some lacing
Aroma of fresh citrus grapefruit, grapefruit zest, floral hops, background of light sweet malts, great nose
Taste of grapefruit, fresh citrus zest, floral, background of nice light sweet fruity pale malts, great flavour for abc
Palate - Very soft carb, light body, little oily, soft sweet malts, bitter floral zest, good bitter sweet balance, very refreshing. Finish as main flavour, floral, bitter zest hop tail
Overall - One of the best golden ales Ive tried

500 ml bottle.
Pours a clear golden colour with a lacy head. Aroma is very citrusy with some herbal notes. Also some interesting lakewater notes. Flavour of crisp citrusy bitterness, pale malts, some biscuit and orange pith. Light bodied, slick mouthfeel and a dry, crisp, biscuity finish. Drinkability is excellent. Great. I wish I had a cask of my own.
Bottle. Golden with a small head. Hoppy with a bitter finish. Stronger than you would expect. An above average session beer.

On cask at The Post Office Vaults. Appearance: light orange, tiny white head. Aroma: wow, very hoppy, catty, some mango too. Smells great. Flavour: catty and mango, a little tropical fruit rind, lovely long fruity finish. Delightful.
Cask in the Salopian Bar, Shrewsbury. Pale with a small white head. Feels a little watery, but there are some good citrus flavours. Lots of grapefruit on the finish. Not bad.

500ml bottle from Les Crepes de Sophie, Shrewsbury. An incredibly full-flavoured ale with lashings of peppery citrus hops; crisp and fresh on the palette, with clean malts and an impeccably dry finish. A deliciously moreish, thirst quenching beer that hits the spot more than any other English ale this year. I have a feeling this will have a regular residency in my fridge over the next few months.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ from beer Ritz
Hazy pale gold, slight white head, herbal nose, pithy bitterness followed by citrus. Medium body+carb

Cask at the Rake, 21/12/13.
Very lightly hazed golden with a moderate off white head.
Nose is juicy hops, straw, orange, apricot jam, grassy.
Taste comprises juicy hops, light mango, orange pith, hint of grapefruit, soft bread dough, citric sherbetism.
Medium bodied, soft carbonation, sweet and hop laden closure.
Top notch GB, lots of juicy hop resonance, good feel.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
This beer is a semi-regular in my local Wetherspoons, but have never seen it anywhere else. This rate/review is from 9th Oct 2013.

Clear golden body every time: always a hand-pulled pint by the way, the head is white and with a creamy texture, lacing clings to the glass.

Floral hop nose and taste with an undercurrent of maltiness trying to get through. The finish is fairly bitter, but not dry: well balanced overall, hops front, rear and center, with a good measure of malts preventing too much bitterness or total hop control.Earlier Rating: 4/7/2012 Total Score: 3.7First had this in the summer of 2010, with friends on the banks of the river Severn about two miles from the brewery: this review however is from another cask ale outlet, my local Wetherspoons in Jan 2012, two pints hand pulled.

This is a good looking beer, golden/light amber body with a full white crown which stays as well as leaving lacing on the glass.

They use US hops in the brew to give it a hoppy aroma and taste, but dont over do it: I guess Cascade (mostly) being the ones giving the hop feel. The smell is therefore hoppy, piney and semi-citrusy.

The taste is predominately hoppy with the malt content preventing a complete take over, good combination of flavours, some grapefruit dryness and bitterness combated by the milder malts.

A very good session bitter and the Salopian beer I now look for when out with friends.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Matthews hall, walsall. Golden beer with medium head and excellent lacing throughout. Aroma of grapefruit and citrus. Taste is grapefruit, some sweetness, or malts and some grain in there. Quite dry. A very good beer.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: From cask. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is grassy and slight herbal. Smooth fruity, peachy, grapefruity and citrusy. Smooth fruity and crisp. Smooth fruity and crisp hoppy finish.

Clear golden beer with minimal head. Smell is impressive - mango, apple, grapefruit. Nice stuff. Body is light. Taste is understated grapefruit, watered down apple juice, sofe bitterness. So drinkable, but not a very exciting flavour. Great smell though!

Gylden klar skum hvid luftig 
Citrus grap malt græs
Bitter meget sød lidt 
Fald tør 
@gbbf 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very clear med golden color. Fantastic citrusy hoppy nose - Grapefruits and apples shine brightly. Decent medium body with grapefruit and cereal note. Hoppy. Great depth. Hops really shine. This is highly quaffable, light English ale. Perfect English summer beer. Outstanding.
Cask at Ealing. Frothy white fair mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Light bitter flavor. Average light bitter finish. Oily palate.

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2016 My Bottom Line:
This crisp and aromatic Golden Ale refreshes with spicy and citrusy hops laid upon well polished straw-like pale malts.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam tops the clear golden.
-Carbonation is not trying to emulate a cask. In this case, its perfectly fine since the bubbly feel enhances the crispness. This drinks like an Anglo interpretation of a German Pils.
-This is gorgeous for our summer heat and humidity.
-Love the nose on this one. Delicate but theres lots going on.
-Ultimately, this is not the most memorable Golden Ale on the world scale. However, its so intricate, polished and quenching that I cannot deem it less than world-class.

Bottle and on cask at The Black Boy Inn, Caernarfon.
Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. This golden beer has citrus and floral hop flavours, toffee notes and a sweet fruity finish.

Light hop aroma with hints of citrus. Lovely hoppy palate with an agreeable slightly woody flavour. Eminently drinkable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
500 ml bottle, with clear golden pour, biscuit & caramel malt backbone, with juicy pithy citrus hop character. Really well balanced. Not a hop bomb, but a really well made ale.
Aromatic, hoppy, elderflower aroma. Taste likewise. Light golden colour. Complex flavours and a dry finish.
Poured a golden/yellow with a tight white head. Aroma of heavy citrus, some underlying malt. Medium body, flavour is grapefruit dominated with a dry, bitter finish.
Cask at JDW Arthur Robertson; clear yellow pour, thin white head, sweet malty aroma, sweet malt taste with delightful citrus notes, a touch of lavender, very pleasant ale.
Cask conditioned at the Winter Gardens (JDW), Harrogate. Thin white head. Gold body. Grapefruit and lychee fruit on the nose, nuts and tangerine. A bitter white sherbet tang. Dry finish.
Tasty pale ale, clear pale yellow appearance with a very small head.  Lots of tropical fruit aroma and flavours.  Thin texture.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2015 Cask at The Watch House, JDW, London. Pours clear yellow with a tight, pure white foam head. Pleasant citrusy aroma, some lime and orange and lemon. Light sweet flavor with moderately dry straw, light doughy biscuits, nice citrus. Light bodied with fine, smooth carbonation. Light bitter citrus peel in the finish, with pale malts and straw. Nice. (January 2013, score: 3.6)<be />Cask at GBBF 2015, day 5 - London. Pours clear yellow with a foamy white head. Beautiful stuff, lots of pissy and citric hops, grapefruit, rindy lemon. Light bodied with fine carboantion; great condition. Rich and vibrant citrusy, pissy and lightly dank hops to finish. Outstanding. (August 2015, score: 4.2)

Cask @ Victoria Station spoonies. The pours a light gold color with a creamy white head. Classic appearance. The nose is lemon poppy seed cake. Sweet cake batter. Summery fruits. Light grass. Inviting aromas. The taste is honeyed bread. Sweet white grape and apricot fruit salad. Slight grassy dry finish. Smooth, light body. Overall, easy-drinking stuff. A simple, well-made golden number. Not bad.

Draught at Waggon & Horses,Halesowen  13th january.Pale gold pour with smallish white head.Citrus aroma including lemon and some caramel.Fruity taste too with some yeastiness and a background malt feel.Tasty and very easy to drink.

Cask at the Post Office Vaults, Birmingham on 28th December 2012. Pale gold with off-white head. Intensely citric hoppiness in aroma and in-mouth. Fine grass and grapefruit abound. Sweetish citric end on a zingy mouthfeel. Exquisite.

Cask at the Post Office Vaults, Birmingham. Poured a clear yellow straw colour with a thin white head. The aroma is hugely fruity with caramel notes. The flavour is not unlike the aroma. Its bitter and fruity too. The palate is good, but the aftertaste lets it down a little. Some bitterness in the aftertaste is always good, but this was not so pleasant. Anyway, its a super session beer and fully deserving of its rating.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2017 On tap at The Post Office Vaults, Birmingham and re-sampled and upgraded at The Sir Robert Peel, Tamworth (23/03/17).  Pale amber ale.  It has that musty elderflower hops aroma - strong and distinctive yet not overly pleasant, like good beer tinged with car park stairwell. The elderflower fairs better in the taste which is full, dry, floral, hoppy, tasty.  A mixed bag.
Floral aroma. Sharp citrus taste with good bittering. Nice but slightly lacking in complexity.

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2014 Cask @ The 3 Judges & 500ml bottle from Beermerchants.com. Clear golden amber colour good head. Tropical & citrus fruit aroma. Grapefruit flavour with bitter aftertaste. A classic blonde beer.

Cask.
Pours a medium straw, with a white head.
Hoppy aroma, lemon, malt, apricot, caramel.
Dry, medium body and bitterness, balanced CO2.
Malty, hoppy taste, grapefruit, apricot, yeast, light spruce, faintly grainy. (2012-11-23)
Cask by handpump at Alloa Beer Festival - clear yellow, frothy white head, aroma of citrus and honey, lemon and honey flavour, bit of grassy, clean finish

Cask (gravity) - Norwich Beer Festival, 2012. A clear orange coloured beer that poured with a loose & fading bubbly white head. Good lemon, lime, orange and grapefruit aromas with a delicate floral note coming through. Some sulphur but otherwise dominated by more orange & lemon with a nice palate malt sweetness beneath lingering into the aftertaste. Soft palate texture, light to medium body with a soft intensity, short to medium length finish.

Cask (handpump) @ Fly In The Loaf, 13 Hardman Street, Liverpool, Merseyside, England L1 9AS.Clear medium yellow colour with a average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, moderate hoppy, citrus, lime. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, fruity. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [20120116]

Oracle. I can create something truly positive out of this situation, just requires time dedication, if I can turn this round it will be a real achievement. I find it amazing that out of the massive number of Golden Ales, Ive rated so many of the top ones. Is that a sign of beervolution (go on Danny, you can have that one)? I need to take a leaf out of that book. Refreshing and hoppy.

500 mL bottle from Beers of Europe into a pint glass.  Golden beer with a fair bubbly head.  Fruity hop aroma, citrus with a bit of zest.  Bitter, biscuity with citrus and little sharpness.  Pretty good solid golden ale.

Bottle from Tanners of Shrewsbury. Golden with gentle bubbles and a decent head. Nose of lemon, honey and cornflakes. Taste of lemon barley water and grapefruit pith. Palate is light to medium in structure a tangy texture and a very dry finish. I was thirsty when I had this but still found it a bit too bitter. Decent though.

Half on handpump at the black eagle, birmingham.
Good white head.  Golden blond pour.  Grapefruit in the aftertaste. Nice
At the Black Eagle, Birmingham.  Clear golden pour with creamy white head.   Citric aroma with some orange.  Citrus hoppy and floral flavour with a medium bitterness

(Cask at Angleterre, 20120331) The beer poured pale golden and clear. Its head was small, white and long lasting. Aroma had citricness, pine and hint of malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were hops, fruitiness, pine, malt and bitterness. Aftertaste was fruity and bitter. Aroma was very nice but the bitterness dominated the taste a bit too much.

Tasted this in The Last Post, Paisley (JDW) in September 2008. Cask, handpump dispense. Crystal clear pale straw in colour with a thin white head. Aromatic hop flowers present in the short nose. Thin mouthfeel and good lacing. Pale malt base gives a citric note of grapefruit and lime zest. Strong citric hop resins impart a dry bitter aftertaste. Finish is dry and pithy with astringent citrus fruit present on the palate. An ok session Blonde Ale to sup over hot summer days.

Cask handpull, The Post Office Vaults, Birmingham, 05/02/12. Beaten, slim lidded gold. Pale and fragranced with delicate lychee and vanilla notes. Lychee and sweet, slightly pissy aroma. Top sessions.
Cask at the Kemble Brewery Inn. Frosty clear orange lager-crisp pour. Great pale ale, would stand tall in Seattle. Golden citrus. Smooth western-balanced hops. Very nice!

Cask (Live & Let Live, Cambridge)
Hop forward. Citrussy, in particular lemony. Pretty pale. Gently sweet malty backbone supporting that. Finish is mostly hops - both a touch of bitter bite, and a pile of citrussy aromatics. I wouldnt be surprised if there was a hint of Cascade in this, given the combination. A good golden ale in the original classic style (Brewers Gold, Summer Lightning, not more modern wimpier ones).

Cask, Coach&Horses, Fenny Bentley. Excellently fruity pale ale, with a lovely lemon zest aroma. Refreshing, with some biscuit in the background. Has a touch of sweetness and a satisfying citrus finish.

Cask, Fly in the Loaf, Liverpool. Clear golden looks with a middling white head. Nose had some decent hoppage and citrus fruit.  Flavour followed along similar lines with some balancing malts. Dryish gently bitter finish. Easy drinking and plenty of character for a 4 percenter.

Cask, Swan & Rushes, Leicester.  Golden with a thin foam.  Aromas are fresh citrus with crisp grapefruit.  Some oranges with low toast malts.  Flavours are sweet marmalade lemon with bittersweet grapefruit.  Peppery, pine hops to finish with a dry aftertaste.  Very refreshing.

Cask at Victoria station, WSpoons, London. A golden coloured pour with a small white head. Hoppy, citrus fruit aroma. Tastes hoppy, citrus fruit, grapefruit, slight bitterness, dry. Very easy to drink, my first Salopian, a really good session ale.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Rake. Golden colour small white head. Aroma is fruits, wood some mild notes of herbs as well as nectar and some sap. Flavour is fruits, herbs, some grass and mild notes of hay. Pleasant balance and rather drinkable Golden Ale.
Cask at the Rake, 27th July 2010. Clear amber with a lacy white head. Restrained citrus and light bready taste. Very drinkable. Perfect quaffing palate. Ideal summer ale.

Hand pulled cask at the Moon on the Hill (Harrow). Gold with a lively white collar and in the peak of condition. Good mixed hop profile with some US varieties it would seem. Perfectly balanced and exeptionally quaffable. A perfect summer beer at 4%.

Cask Handpump at Edgeley Park, Stockport 04/06/2010
Fruity aroma. Clear golden coloured hoppy and fruity grapefruit flavour with a dry and slightly bitter finish.

Hand pulled at the Waggon and Horses, Oldbury. A breath of hops in a thin, but tightly constructed body. Short finish, but a reasonable balance whilst in the mouth. Slightly acrid in the throat with some malt/peardrop. Goodish.
10th July 2009. Light gold beer. Lovely fresh bitter bursting with fruity ornage and grapefruit. Not that bitter.
UPDATED: MAY 5, 2014 Cask - The Falcon Willenhall. Powerful aroma of green grassy citrus hops, slight malt sweetness dominated by strong hop finish

Cask @ Volunteer Arms, GBBF 2008. Pours a pale yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty hoppy citrus aroma. Sweetish malty hoppy bitter grapefruit flavor. Has a long hoppy bitter citrus finish.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2009 A glorious surprise, sparkling clear with frothy white head. A powerful aroma of hops, lemons and grapefruit, push through a crisp malt background. A long finish with plenty in the middle.
Cask wetherspoons.

Cask conditioned at The Castle, Furnival St., LondonHazy blond color. Very nice aroma of English hops, fruity too. Even at this low alcohol, it has a good mouthfeel, with good malt flavor and very good hopping, flowery (a light presence of elderflower comes to mind). Long final. One of the best cask ales in London this week. Excellent.

Cask at the alfread herring. Aroma is excellent, great citrusy, peppery, green fresh hop. Taste is slight honey pale malt sweetness, but completly dominated by the excellent fresh citrusy hop character.

Cask conditioned at a Wetherspoons. Gold with white head. Malty biscuity body, quite crisp leading to a sharp hoppy, tangy flavour, citric, grapefruit and refreshingly bitter. good fresh hoppy beer, pretty decent.
Cask-conditioned at a JDW in Swindon 30/10/08. Gold with next to no head. Hoppy aroma and flavour of citrus, with a whiff of pine and spiciness giving way to a decent bitter finish. Good stuff.

Cask at The Regal, JDW, Cambridge, 11-10-08   Straw coloured, (light was very dim so might not be totally correct) Good tang to this beer, nice soft lemonyness, furry bitterness ripples across the roof of mouth.
Cask conditioned - handpump - JDW, Northampton. A golden ale with nice citrus notes throughout.  Good orange and grapefruit flavours.  Nice fresh hoppy and tasty.
Cask gravity at White Horse, Hedgerley.  Tastes a bit cascadey. Decent aroma. Bit of nettle. But drinkable enough.
A Mes rate: cask at the White Horse in Hedgerley.Mid gold with no head. Lovely citric hops and spice with some slight cinnamon. Good bitterness in the finish. Downable and enjoyable.
